activities:
SpotMe obtains user data from 4 sources:

1. Imports from or integration with other databases
2. Data entered into the SpotMe Mobile Event App by the user
3. Data entered into the SpotMe content management system by the event organizer
4. Interactions among mobile devices running the SpotMe Mobile Event App or between mobile devices running the SpotMe Mobile Event App and other components of the SpotMe system
for the purpose of an event mobile application.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Public personally identifiable information (PPII) : PPI includes the typical information that can be seen on an Event Participant badge. This information includes (but is not limited to) first name, initial, last name, job title, company name, work country, department.  2.	Confidential personally identifiable information (CPII) : CPII includes (but is not limited to) contact details such as email.
privacyprograms: Self-regulatory privacy program that adheres to the Safe Harbor Privacy Principles
recoursemech:
The Panel established by the EU Data Protection Authorities (DPA) for disputes received by SpotMe from the EU/EEA
The Swiss FDPIC for disputes involving personal information received by SpotMe from Switzerland.
